Claim: You can check for coronavirus by holding your breath for 10 seconds.
Explaination: There is no evidence to support the claim that holding your breath for several seconds is an effective way to test for coronavirus
Label: False
html:
Claim: You can check for coronavirus by holding your breath for 10 seconds.

Explanation:There is no evidence to support the claim that holding your breath for several seconds is an effective way to test for coronavirus

https://jrnl.ie/5048482

Claim: China is supplying the Quran to people to read after the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: This is at least a seven-year-old video and has no relation to coronavirus.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: China is supplying the Quran to people to read after the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:This is at least a seven-year-old video and has no relation to coronavirus.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/china-not-supplying-quran-as-antidote-coronavirus-1654559-2020-03-11

Claim: All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 per week to stay at home to avoid spread of coronavirus.
Explaination: U.S. citizens may get some economic relief from Congress at some point, but that could still be a few weeks away.
Label: False
html:
Claim: All U.S. citizens are entitled to $700 per week to stay at home to avoid spread of coronavirus.

Explanation:U.S. citizens may get some economic relief from Congress at some point, but that could still be a few weeks away.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471987-fact-check-all-us-citizens-are-not-entitled-to-700-dollars-to-stay-at-home-to-avoid-spread-of-coronavirus.html

Claim: Vietnam was the first country to contain and develop a quick test for SARS and COVID-19.
Explaination: The claims that Vietnam was the first country to contain SARS and developed a quick test kit are mostly legit. We're not sure where the claim that WHO says it takes four years to develop a test kit comes from. But that appears to not be accurate.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Vietnam was the first country to contain and develop a quick test for SARS and COVID-19.

Explanation:The claims that Vietnam was the first country to contain SARS and developed a quick test kit are mostly legit. We're not sure where the claim that WHO says it takes four years to develop a test kit comes from. But that appears to not be accurate.

https://youtu.be/69Pl_6Nzhio

Claim: A video of former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram alongside a claim it shows him stating the U.S threatened to spread the novel coronavirus in Iraq during a meeting in the 1990s.
Explaination: The claim is false; the video's audio has been doctored; the original Associated Press archive footage does not include any reference to COVID-19.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video of former Iraqi dictator Saddam Hussein has been shared repeatedly on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram alongside a claim it shows him stating the U.S threatened to spread the novel coronavirus in Iraq during a meeting in the 1990s.

Explanation:The claim is false; the video's audio has been doctored; the original Associated Press archive footage does not include any reference to COVID-19.

https://factcheck.afp.com/audio-associated-press-footage-saddam-hussein-has-been-doctored

Claim: India will go under lockdown from 4/15/20 to 6/15/20.
Explaination: Government Of India has clarified that this audio is fake and has no authenticity.
Label: False
html:
Claim: India will go under lockdown from 4/15/20 to 6/15/20.

Explanation:Government Of India has clarified that this audio is fake and has no authenticity.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/20/fact-check-india-will-go-on-a-lock-down-from-15th-april-to-15th-june-2020/

Claim: A purported news report claims that Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte approved the release of P20,000 (USD $400) to all recipients of the Philippines’ Social Security System (SSS) to help them through the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the SSS said the report was “fake news"; the website that published the claim is also not a reputable news source.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A purported news report claims that Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte approved the release of P20,000 (USD $400) to all recipients of the Philippines’ Social Security System (SSS) to help them through the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the SSS said the report was “fake news"; the website that published the claim is also not a reputable news source.

https://factcheck.afp.com/philippines-social-security-agency-said-report-about-covid-19-benefit-payment-was-fake-news

Claim: Clorox Already Knew About Coronavirus And Coronavirus Isn’t A New Virus.
Explaination: The post claiming that the new coronavirus was known beforehand as Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus’ is misleading.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Clorox Already Knew About Coronavirus And Coronavirus Isn’t A New Virus.

Explanation:The post claiming that the new coronavirus was known beforehand as Clorox label shows that it kills human coronavirus’ is misleading.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-post-claiming-clorox-already-knew-about-coronavirus-and-coronavirus-isnt-new-virus-is-misleading/

Claim: Rs 2000 notes scattered in Delhi to spread Coronavirus infection.
Explaination: The incident has no connection with COVID-19, A person accidentally dropped some currency notes and later returned to claim the same, which was handed to him by the local police team.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Rs 2000 notes scattered in Delhi to spread Coronavirus infection.

Explanation:The incident has no connection with COVID-19, A person accidentally dropped some currency notes and later returned to claim the same, which was handed to him by the local police team.

https://www.factcrescendo.com/fact-check-people-scattered-notes-to-spread-coronavirus-in-delhi/

Claim: India has developed a treatment for coronavirus.
Explaination: The headline of the viral article is misleading. So far, India has not claimed any such discovery.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: India has developed a treatment for coronavirus.

Explanation:The headline of the viral article is misleading. So far, India has not claimed any such discovery.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/fact-check-no-india-has-not-developed-any-treatment-for-coronavirus-1648091-2020-02-19

Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”
Explaination: The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “The Chinese Communist Party is using Zoom as a way to spy on our citizens.”

Explanation:The claim is based on a report from researchers at the University of Toronto. But one of the researchers told us that while they identified security issues with Zoom, whether China has exploited the platform for espionage was not something they considered.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/07/charlie-kirk/china-spying-you-through-zoom-charlie-kirk-oversta/

Claim: “Gale of the wind” and “Neem Tree” leaves are good medicine to protect from the coronavirus.
Explaination: As stated by WHO still there is no official remedy or cure for COVID-19, while some of the traditional methods have symptomatic improvements.
Label: False
html:
Claim: “Gale of the wind” and “Neem Tree” leaves are good medicine to protect from the coronavirus.

Explanation:As stated by WHO still there is no official remedy or cure for COVID-19, while some of the traditional methods have symptomatic improvements.

https://srilanka.factcrescendo.com/tamil/fact-check-gale-of-the-wind-and-neem-tree-leaf-are-good-medicine-to-protect-from-corona-virus/

Claim: A video shows a market in the Chinese city of Wuhan, where the deadly coronavirus strain emerged.
Explaination: The video actually shows a market in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows a market in the Chinese city of Wuhan, where the deadly coronavirus strain emerged.

Explanation:The video actually shows a market in Indonesia’s Sulawesi island.

http://newsmobile.in/articles/2020/01/31/this-viral-video-of-a-meat-market-is-not-from-wuhan-heres-the-fact-check/

Claim: “The new fad disease called the ‘coronavirus’ is sweeping headlines. Funny enough, there was a patent for the coronavirus was filed in 2015 and granted in 2018.”
Explaination: All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus
Label: (Org. doesn't apply rating)
html:
Claim: “The new fad disease called the ‘coronavirus’ is sweeping headlines. Funny enough, there was a patent for the coronavirus was filed in 2015 and granted in 2018.”

Explanation:All of the posts link to patents that are related to two different viruses in the coronavirus family. There is no patent related to the new virus

https://www.factcheck.org/2020/01/social-media-posts-spread-bogus-coronavirus-conspiracy-theory?check=1

Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.
Label: False
html:
Claim: NY banned cigarette sales because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:Gov. Andrew Cuomo's team told Lead Stories that he is not about to announce a six-week ban on cigarette sales to help curb the death rate from COVID-19, which has devastated the state.

html:

ann02_remarks: it should also be classified as "virus transmission" as the meme is about both virus characteristics as well as virus transmission

Claim: “U.S. deaths since 1/22/20: COVID-19, 27; flu, 4,700; abortion, 118,000.”
Explaination: The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: “U.S. deaths since 1/22/20: COVID-19, 27; flu, 4,700; abortion, 118,000.”

Explanation:The post’s numbers are inaccurate, but abortions do far outnumber deaths from COVID-19 and flu. The COVID-19 number is likely too low, and the flu number is too high. The number of abortions is roughly accurate.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/24/facebook-posts/post-leans-flawed-numbers-compare-number-abortions/

Claim: 5G Technology believed to have caused the coronavirus.
Explaination: The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.
Label: False
html:
Claim: 5G Technology believed to have caused the coronavirus.

Explanation:The claim is false, not backed by scientific research, and many dates given to back up the theory are wrong or misleading.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3472004-fact-check-5g-technology-not-believed-to-have-caused-coronavirus.html?check=1

Claim: Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspends all incoming and outgoing flights to China.
Explaination: Russian government had imposed some temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot (AFLT.MM), stopped flying to China from Jan. 31. Small airline Ikar will also continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until Feb. 29.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Russia announces the closure of airspace and suspends all incoming and outgoing flights to China.

Explanation:Russian government had imposed some temporary and partial ban on the movement of Chinese nationals. All Russian airlines, with the exception of national airline Aeroflot (AFLT.MM), stopped flying to China from Jan. 31. Small airline Ikar will also continue flights between Moscow and China. All planes arriving from China will be sent to a separate terminal in the Moscow Sheremetyevo airport. Aeroflot reduced the frequency of flights to Beijing, Shanghai, and Guangzhou until Feb. 29.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15029421

Claim: Some countries are throwing away bodies of coronavirus patients into the sea.
Explaination: The video is from 2014 when bodies of migrant workers had washed ashore following a shipwreck near a Libyan beach.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Some countries are throwing away bodies of coronavirus patients into the sea.

Explanation:The video is from 2014 when bodies of migrant workers had washed ashore following a shipwreck near a Libyan beach.

Explaination: The same video was posted YouTube on October 24th, 2019, which was before the first case of coronavirus got reported in China in December 2019.
Label: False
